cons: The wages given for the work responsibilities are almost laughable.

pros: A true eye opener to the reality of hospital life

pros: The health insurance is affordable for single or family coverage.  The hospital raised its minimum wage from $7.25 to $8/hr.
cons:
Work environments are not always safe for the patients or staff.

The management is terrible.  They are authoritarians and write you up for being insubordinate if you voice your opinion.  

They call the staff off and send staff home early even when the census and acuity is high.

The hospital is filthy and in need of repair.

Patient care is horrendous.  The nurses took over 90 minutes to bring me pain medication every time I asked some (following a laparoscopic cholecystectomy) and the only time I ever saw a nurse was when they finally brought the pain medication in.  I also hear staff bad-mouthing patients all through out the hospital.

The overall morale is despicable.  Employees are miserable in every department of the hospital.

The hospital is trying to cut $30-million from its budget.  Staffing is being flexed off in order to pinch pennies, bed spreads are no longer being used because they cost more to launder.  

They're more concerned with money than they are with quality patient care, patient/staff safety,  and patient/staff satisfaction.

RNs are underpaid.

On the 3-11 shift, there are 3 nurses, a secretary, and 4 techs on my floor looking for different jobs with different organizations.  

Apply at your own risk!

review_title: Great opportunity for experience as LPN
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Dothan, AL
pros: You will get some invaluable experience working here.  It is under guidance of the Joint Commission on the Accreditations of Healthcare, of which this facility does adhere.  Also good experience as far as how things should be done.  LPN's work along side of RN's and are treated with equal respect from administration, RN's and physicians.
cons: Pay is lower than other jobs in the area.  Evaluation packet to get a raise was time consuming lengthy and redundant.  Raises sometimes go on hiatus.  As a med-surg nurse you will frequently have a high nurse to patient ratio sometimes as high as 7:1.  PCA/CNA are not well staffed on floors sometimes as low as 4 to a 42 bed floor.  Staff turn over rate is high.

job_title: Information Systems Engineer in Dothan, AL
pros: Enjoyed the work and learned a lot from experiences.  There was always plenty to do for the self motivated person.  It was a very dynamic environment with constant change with  big budgets.
cons: Management was terrible from directors up.  There was a lot of clicks and most are only in position because they just hung around doing minimum. It was easy for those that did not have good work ethic to skate by with bare minimum.

pros: The nursing staff is very nice and helpful to work with.
cons: Pay is awful needs to be in this decade!  The nurse techs and nurse aids are very disrespectful.  Management does nothing for this.  The insurance is to expensive and we have to wear white uniforms which gets dirty too easily.  Oh and no one has gotten a raise in 2 years. Bad ethics.
